data.title: Announcements
data.text:
e-flux Education announcements are a direct emailing of text and image press releases sent to our growing audience of arts professionals and academics worldwide. The email announcement includes an active URL that links directly to each client’s site.

e-flux Education also offers a special format for announcing Graduate Exhibitions, which includes a large image gallery, extended exhibition text, and significant promotion of graduating artists through multiple social media posts.

Each e-flux Education announcement is sent to more than 60,000 e-mail subscribers and is shared on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Announcements are also distributed through the e-flux app which has 16,000 users. The e-flux site, where announcements are permanently archived, receives approximately 600,000 unique visitors per month. The open rate for emails is up to 34%, depending on the content.

e-flux Education’s readership is made up almost exclusively of arts professionals and academics; 47% are located in Europe; 42% in North America, and 11% in Africa, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Art schools and universities, such as: Academy of Fine Arts, Vienna; Art, Culture, and Technology Program at MIT; California Institute of the Arts; Center for Curatorial Studies, Bard College; China Academy of Art; Columbia University School of the Arts; The Cooper Union; École Nationale Supérieure des Beaux-Arts; Goldsmiths, University of London; Institute Art Gender Nature, FHNW Academy of Art and Design in Basel; Maryland Institute College of Art; The New School; Oslo National Academy of the Arts; Piet Zwart Institute; Pratt Institute; Rhode Island School of Design; Royal College of Art; Sandberg Instituut Amsterdam; School of the Art Institute of Chicago; School of Visual Arts; Städelschule; Tokyo University of the Arts; University of California, Los Angeles; Yale School of Art; Zurich University of the Arts.

Museums, galleries, and art centers, such as: Beeler Gallery at Columbus College of Art and Design; Bemis Center for Contemporary Arts; Colby College Museum of Art; De Appel; Institute of Contemporary Art at the University of Pennsylvania; Middlesbrough Institute of Modern Art; Tai Kwun.

Residencies and fellowship programs, such as: Beta-Local; The Core Program at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston; Jan Van Eyck Academie; La Becque Artist Residency; Maumaus Independent Study Program; Nida Art Colony of Vilnius Academy of Arts; RUPERT; Saas-Fee Summer Institute of Art; Sommerakademie Paul Klee; Skowhegan School of Painting & Sculpture; SOMA.

Publications and presses, such as: Amsterdam University Press, FIELD Journal; Journal for Artistic Research; OnCurating; PARSE Journal; Portable Grey; Unlikely – Journal for Creative Arts; NYUPress.

Organizations and networks, such as: Archives of Women Artists Research and Exhibitions (AWARE); College Art Association; Common Field; ELIA; FACE Foundation; Forecast; Project Anywhere; Robert Rauschenberg Foundation; Voices in Contemporary Art (VoCA).
